com.ntechniks.nstudios.androidutils

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ntechniks.nstudios.androidutils.FileUtils

  • public final class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    File Utilities class that helps saving files to a storage.

    1.2.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nikola Georgiev

    • Method Detail

      • saveInternalFile

        @Nullable
public static android.net.Uri saveInternalFile(android.content.Context context,
                                                         java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         java.lang.String subDir,
                                                         java.lang.String fileName,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         java.lang.String permissions)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Use this method in order to save any file as InputStream into the device internal storage files. The file will be located within the application package in directory "files". The location of your application package is different to each Android system and may vary. Here you can find just a sample path.

        Example: "file:///data/data/user/0/org/example/files/your-sub-dir/"

        Parameters:
        context - Context - The base application context.
        inputStream - InputStream - The file you'd like to save as input stream.
        subDir - String - The sub-directory name where you'd like to save the file.
        fileName - String - The name of the file that will be saved.
        permissions - String - In case the directory doesn't exist, it will create new file with the following permissions attribute.
        Returns:
        Uri - The Uri path of the saved file. NULL - in case either some of the context, inputStream, and fileName has Null Pointer, the file cannot be saved due to some interruption, missing permission, or the storage is full.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • saveFile

        @Nullable
public static android.net.Uri saveFile(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                 java.io.File file,
                                                 @Nullable
                                                 java.lang.String permissions)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Use this method in order to save any file as InputStream into the device internal or external storage files. First should check whether you have permissions to read/write files at this location, otherwise RuntimeException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - InputStream - The file you'd like to save as input stream.
        file - String - The file that will be saved.
        permissions - String - In case the directory doesn't exist, it will create new file with the following permissions attribute.
        Returns:
        Uri - The Uri path of the saved file. NULL - in case either some of the inputStream, directory, or fileName has Null Pointer, the file cannot be saved due to some interruption, missing permission, or the storage is full.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • saveFile

        @Nullable
public static android.net.Uri saveFile(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                 java.io.File directory,
                                                 java.lang.String fileName,
                                                 int accessMode)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Use this method in order to save any file as InputStream into the device internal or external storage files. First should check whether you have permissions to read/write files at this location, otherwise RuntimeException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - InputStream - The file you'd like to save as input stream.
        directory - String - The directory name where you'd like to save the file.
        fileName - String - The name of the file that will be saved.
        accessMode - String - In case the directory doesn't exist, it will create new file with the following permissions attribute.
        Returns:
        Uri - The Uri path of the saved file. NULL - in case either some of the inputStream, directory, or fileName has Null Pointer, the file cannot be saved due to some interruption, missing permission, or the storage is full.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • saveTempBitmap

        @Nullable
public static android.net.Uri saveTempBitmap(android.content.Context context,
                                                       android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       java.lang.String subDir,
                                                       java.lang.String fileName)
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Use this method to save a temporary image file, in case the internal device storage is writable. The file will be located within the application package in directory "files/cache". The location of your application package is different to each Android system and may vary. Here you can find just a sample path.

        Example: "file:///data/data/user/0/org/example/files/cache/your-sub-dir/"

        Parameters:
        context - Context - The base application context.
        bitmap - Bitmap - An instance of the image bitmap that will be saved.
        subDir - String - The sub-directory name where you'd like to save the file.
        fileName - String - The name of the file that will be saved.
        Returns:
        Uri - The Uri path of the saved file. NULL - in case either some of the context, bitmap, and fileName have Null Pointer.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • createFile

        @Nullable
public static java.io.File createFile(@NonNull
                                                java.io.File directory,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.lang.String fileName,
                                                @Nullable
                                                java.lang.String permissions)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Creates File object based on a directory path and file name. It creates instance only when the given directory is readable and the file can be written.
        Parameters:
        directory - File - The directory where you'd like to save the file.
        fileName - String - The name of the file that is saved.
        permissions - String - In case the directory doesn't exist, it will create new file and dir with the following permissions attribute.
        Returns:
        File - The newly created file in the given directory with the given file name.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • createFile

        @Nullable
public static java.io.File createFile(java.io.File file,
                                                @Nullable
                                                java.lang.String permissions)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Creates File object based on a directory path and file name. It creates instance only when the given directory is readable and the file can be written.
        Parameters:
        file - File - The file that will be saved.
        permissions - String - In case the file doesn't exist, it will create new file or dir with the following permissions attribute.
        Returns:
        File - The newly created file in the given directory with the given file name.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • isExistingReadableDir

        public static boolean isExistingReadableDir(java.io.File directory)
        This method checks whether the given directory is an actual directory, does exist and has read privileges.
        Parameters:
        directory - File - The directory which you'd like to check whether exists and/or is readable.
        Returns:
        boolean - Whether the directory has been created or not.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • isExistingWritableDir

        public static boolean isExistingWritableDir(java.io.File directory)

      • isTempFileExisting

        public static boolean isTempFileExisting(android.content.Context context,
                                         java.lang.String subDir,
                                         java.lang.String fileName)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Checks whether a given file with name exists in the cache directory.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The base application context.
        subDir - String - The sub-directory name where you'd like to save the file.
        fileName - String - The name of the file that is saved.
        Returns:
        boolean - True - in case the file exists, False - in case the file does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • isInternalStorageWritable

        public static boolean isInternalStorageWritable(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if internal storage is available for read and write.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The base application context.
        Returns:
        boolean - True - in case the internal storage of the device is writable, False - in case has no permissions to write in the device internal storage.
        Throws:
        java.security.AccessControlException - - the AccessController to indicate that a requested access (to a critical system resource such as the file system or the network) is denied.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • createZipInputStream

        public static java.util.zip.ZipInputStream createZipInputStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        Creates new ZipInputStream out of incoming InputStream. The UTF-8 charset is used to decode the entry names. This method is Null-safe.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - InputStream - An input stream to the file, which will be used to create ZipInputStream.
        Returns:
        ZipInputStream - A new instance to a zip input stream. NULL - in case the param inputStream has Null Pointer.
        Since:
        1.2.0
